basics.name: Chaance T. Graves
basics.label: Senior Systems Engineer
basics.summary: Results-driven system applications engineer offering expertise in consistently delivering innovative hardware and software solutions that enhance operational efficiency and accelerate time-to-market for stakeholders via optimal server design applications. Strategic thinker, innovative business partner, effective communicator, and problem-solving project manager known for building strong partnerships to leverage system design, embedded systems, and agile software practices to provide high-performance, reliable solutions that meet project requirements. Cross-collaborative leader and resourceful team contributor with demonstrated success in directing diverse teams to troubleshoot, provide exceptional technical support, and enhance expertise and leadership capabilities on state-of-the-art technologies.

work.name: Intel Corporation
work.summary: Datacenter and AI Group: Xeon Platforms Systems Engineering: Led account ownership for board design, Power-On, and product development support for designs tailored for general computing, AI workloads, data management, and storage solutions.
highlights: Consistently achieved Net Promoter Scores (NPS) of 80%+ by maintaining consistent closure rate on support tickets spanning debug requests, design reviews, specific technical inquiries, and product enhancement feedback, resulting in a 20% reduction in average issue resolution time.
Led a team in developing and deploying a custom web application and CLI with REST API integration from OpenBMC Redfish protocol to optimize reference platform management.
Streamlined manual processes into real-time monitoring of system configuration and power consumption in seconds, recognized as a top innovative tool in the organization.

work.name: Intel Corporation
work.summary: Supervised logistics for pre-production hardware and system configuration support for regional account teams and technical experts of Intel Xeon subsystems.
highlights: Led development of 24/7 monitoring tools for lab power consumption and environmental compliance using cost-effective hardware and software solutions.
Standardized remote PC setup via Ansible and implemented power control units from various PDU vendors to enhance remote capabilities.
Authored Service Level Agreements and Standard Operating Procedures for internal customers, enabling a remote access capable environment for on-demand issue replication.

certificates.name: Artificial Intelligence: Implications for Business Strategy
